description: Add `tickets.master_ticket_id` to represent master/child bundle linkage.
Index child lookups by `(tenant, master_ticket_id)`.
Persist per-master bundle settings: `mode` and `reopen_on_child_reply`.
Persist idempotency keys for mirrored bundle updates to avoid duplicate mirrors.
Mark mirrored bundle comments as `is_system_generated`.
Expose bundle fields on ticket and comment API types (master linkage, rollups, system-generated flag).
Enforce: a ticket can belong to at most one bundle at a time.
Enforce: prevent cycles in bundle linkage (no ticket can be its own ancestor).
Enforce: bundling is same-tenant only (tenant-isolated under existing RLS patterns).
Permission-gate bundle management operations (create/add/remove/promote/unbundle).
Restrict bundling operations to users who can update all involved tickets.
Create a bundle from 2+ selected tickets by selecting a master and mode (default: sync updates).
Add a child ticket to an existing bundle.
Remove a child ticket from a bundle (unlink only that ticket).
Unbundle a master ticket (detach all children and remove settings).
Promote a child ticket to become the new master while retaining bundle membership.
Fetch bundle membership (master + children) and bundle settings for ticket detail views.
Update per-bundle settings (mode, reopen-on-reply) from the master ticket UI.
Ticket list supports a toggle between “Bundled view” (collapsed bundles) and “Individual view” (grouped tickets).
Persist the user's bundle view preference (local storage is acceptable).
Bundled view hides child rows and shows only master/standalone tickets.
Bundled view searching can match against child ticket identifiers/titles and returns the master.
Bundled view filtering (status/priority/board/client) remains correct for bundle-aware results.
Individual view groups children under their master when both appear in the result set.
Child rows show a “Bundled” indicator that references the master ticket number when shown outside an expanded group.
Bulk selection enables “Bundle Tickets” when 2+ tickets are selected.
Bundle modal allows selecting a master from the selection and choosing whether to sync updates.
Master ticket shows a bundle panel with child list and navigation links.
Master bundle panel supports add child, remove child, promote child to master, and unbundle actions.
Child tickets display a banner linking to their master ticket.
Child workflow fields (status/assignment/priority) are locked in the UI by default.
Server enforces locked workflow fields for bundled children (cannot change status/assignment/priority directly).
Child tickets keep their current status when bundled (no automatic closure/transition).
Master conversation surfaces inbound child public replies as view-only, child-attributed items (not duplicated onto the master).
Aggregated child replies do not create additional outbound emails by themselves.
In sync-updates mode, master status/assignment/priority updates propagate to all children.
In sync-updates mode, master closure fields propagate to children (closed_at/closed_by).
In sync-updates mode, master public comments are mirrored onto children as system-generated comments.
Mirrored comments are idempotent and do not duplicate on retries.
Internal notes on the master are not mirrored to children by default.
System-generated mirrored comments cannot be edited or deleted (UI + server enforcement).
Prevent creating time entries on bundled children (time is logged on the master).
Public master updates notify all child requesters by default (email fanout to child requesters; dedupe by email).
When a child is removed from a bundle, future updates/notifications follow normal rules for that child.
Optionally notify all child requesters when the master is closed (closure fanout policy).
Reopen-on-reply: if enabled, an inbound child reply can reopen the master ticket.
Bundles may span multiple clients/companies within the same tenant (no same-client constraint).
UI clearly indicates when a bundle spans multiple clients/companies and surfaces per-child client context.
Bundling across multiple clients shows a warning/confirmation step before completing the bundle/add-child action.
Bundle operations surface clear validation errors in the UI (e.g., already bundled, same-tenant requirement).
